entries.name: Main CLI bootstraps config, models, and coder loop
entries.description: `projects/Aider/aider/main.py` collects search order `.aider.conf.yml` (current directory -> git root -> home), picks up `--env-file` through `load_dotenv_files`, reassembles the arguments and enables shell completion processing `--set-env`/`--api-key`. After opt-in anonymous analytics and model selection (`select_default_model`, `offer_openrouter_oauth`) `setup_git`/`check_gitignore` preparing the repository. `register_models` And `register_litellm_models` connect custom YAML/JSON, then `Coder.create(...)` receives `Commands`, `ChatSummary`, Git context and options (auto lint/test, map tokens, watchers). At the end `FileWatcher` And `ClipboardWatcher` are turned on by flags, and `coder.run()` spins in a loop, processing `SwitchCoder` and completing GUI/commit/test scripts.

entries.name: ConfigArgParse layers CLI, config files, and env overrides
entries.description: `aider/args.py` `get_parser` constructs a `configargparse.ArgumentParser` with `default_config_files`, `auto_env_var_prefix="AIDER_"`, and YAML config parsing so CLI args, config files, and environment variables resolve in one place; this keeps the precedence that `main.py` sets when starting the session.

entries.name: CLI validates edit formats against registered coders
entries.description: `get_parser` dynamically imports `aider.coders.__all__` and builds `edit_format_choices`, wiring them into `--edit-format`/`--chat-mode` validation and shell completion so new coder classes automatically become valid CLI options.

entries.name: .env cascade loads OAuth keys before repo overrides
entries.description: `main.py` `load_dotenv_files` uses `generate_search_path_list` to scan ~/.env, repo, and cwd locations, but first inserts `~/.aider/oauth-keys.env` and loads each file with `load_dotenv(..., override=True)` while tolerating OS errors, ensuring secrets from OAuth land before project-level overrides.

entries.name: Main re-runs argument parsing when real git root differs
entries.description: After parsing CLI flags, `main` calls `guessed_wrong_repo` and, if Git reports a different working tree, recurses into `main(..., force_git_root=right_repo_root)` so config discovery and history files align with the actual repository.

entries.name: History files default to git-root .aider paths
entries.description: `get_parser` computes `.aider.input.history` and `.aider.chat.history.md` relative to the detected git root so chat transcripts stay alongside the repository instead of the shell's cwd.

entries.name: Cache flags control prompt caching keepalive
entries.description: The CLI exposes `--cache-prompts` and `--cache-keepalive-pings` so sessions can warm litellm's prompt cache for a set number of five minute pings without custom scripts.

entries.name: Repo map flags tune refresh policy and scaling
entries.description: `--map-tokens`, `--map-refresh`, and `--map-multiplier-no-files` let operators size the repo map budget and pick auto/manual refresh triggers so large codebases remain manageable.

entries.name: Output color flags customize the terminal palette
entries.description: The Output settings group offers `--dark-mode`, `--light-mode`, and individual color overrides for user, tool, warning, and assistant streams so contributors can match their terminal theme.

entries.name: Analytics flags support runtime opt-in and custom hosts
entries.description: CLI options like `--analytics`, `--analytics-log`, and `--analytics-posthog-host` feed straight into `Analytics`, letting teams disable tracking, log events locally, or point at a private PostHog instance.

entries.name: Upgrade switches cover checks and reinstall paths
entries.description: The Upgrading group wires `--just-check-update`, `--check-update`, `--upgrade/--update`, and `--install-main-branch` so maintainers can poll PyPI or reinstall from main without leaving the CLI.

entries.name: Voice settings expose format, language, and device
entries.description: `--voice-format`, `--voice-language`, and `--voice-input-device` configure the capture pipeline so voice sessions can target mp3/webm outputs or select a specific microphone.

entries.name: args helpers emit Markdown, YAML, and shell completions
entries.description: `get_md_help`, `get_sample_yaml`, and `get_sample_dotenv` swap parser formatters while `main()` routes to `shtab.complete`, giving packaged docs and completion scripts via `python -m aider.args`.

entries.name: __main__ module forwards python -m aider to main()
entries.description: `aider/__main__.py` simply imports `main` from `aider.main` and invokes it when run as a module, so `python -m aider` mirrors the CLI entrypoint without duplicating boot logic.

entries.name: ModelInfoManager caches remote metadata and merges settings
entries.description: `projects/Aider/aider/models.py` holds `ModelSettings`, aliases and default `DEFAULT_MODEL_NAME`; `ModelInfoManager` caches `model_prices_and_context_window.json`, respects `--verify-ssl` and merges the OpenRouter directory. Constructor `Model` matches aliases, selects weak/editor models and applies overrides from `aider/extra_params`. Tests `tests/basic/test_models.py` reset `MODEL_SETTINGS` and check that `get_model_info` returns an empty dict for unknown models, confirming cache validity.

entries.name: Model.validate_environment bridges litellm diagnostics and provider heuristics
entries.description: `Model.validate_environment` executes first `fast_validate_environment`, then wraps `litellm.validate_environment`, interprets `AWS_PROFILE` as a valid key and calls `validate_variables` for providers. IN `tests/basic/test_models.py` Mock IO and environment check that `sanity_check_model` marks options as Set/Not set and calls dependency checks, confirming feedback to the user.

entries.name: configure_model_settings applies generic overrides and merges extra_params
entries.description: `Model.configure_model_settings` copies `MODEL_SETTINGS`, applies `apply_generic_model_settings` for o1/DeepSeek/Qwen/Llama and deep merge families `extra_params`. Kit `tests/basic/test_models.py::test_configure_model_settings` checks a dozen aliases, proving that repo-map, temperature and reminders are set as the documentation expects.

entries.name: Model.get_repo_map_tokens scales repo map quota from context window
entries.description: `Model.get_repo_map_tokens` divides `max_input_tokens` by eight, limiting the result between 1024 and 4096 tokens and thereby scaling the repo map to the context of the model. Test `tests/basic/test_models.py::test_get_repo_map_tokens` passes the boundary values (4096, 8192, 32768), fixing the formula.

entries.name: OpenRouter metadata falls back to HTML scraping when API cache misses
entries.description: `ModelInfoManager.fetch_openrouter_model_info` assembles the OpenRouter model URL, scrapes context length and pricing with regex, and only returns a dict when all pieces parse, giving OpenRouter models a fallback when the cached JSON lacks entries.

entries.name: ModelSettings dataclass drives default LLM behavior
entries.description: `ModelSettings` describes the format of edits, repo map, undo replies, temperature and editor overrides and is loaded from `model-settings.yml` when importing. Test `tests/basic/test_models.py::test_aider_extra_model_settings` confirms that overrides via `register_models` inherit default headers and max_tokens, which prevents silent regressions.

entries.name: MODEL_ALIASES normalizes shorthand model names
entries.description: Table `MODEL_ALIASES` matches short names (`sonnet`, `deepseek`, `flash-lite`) with canonical identifiers to keep the CLI and configs concise. Unit test `tests/basic/test_models.py::test_model_aliases` goes through key aliases (`sonnet`, `haiku`, `4`, `35turbo`), ensuring that the dictionary remains up to date.

entries.name: apply_generic_model_settings tailors defaults per family
entries.description: The generic overrides table toggles the edit_format, repo map, temperature and reasoning flags for the o1, DeepSeek, Claude 3.x, Qwen and Llama3 families. Block `tests/basic/test_models.py::test_configure_model_settings` compares expectations for each branch so that the arrival of a new family does not break the checks.

entries.name: get_editor_model derives editor variants and formats
entries.description: When an editor model or edit format is supplied, `get_editor_model` constructs a sibling `Model` and prefixes `editor-` onto diff formats so the editor pipeline always uses compatible coders.

entries.name: register_models loads user YAML overrides into MODEL_SETTINGS
entries.description: `register_models` skips missing YAML, loads entries into `ModelSettings`, replaces existing names and prints which files were included. Test `tests/basic/test_models.py::test_aider_extra_model_settings` generates temporary YAML and ensures that new `extra_headers` And `some_param` fall into the model, thereby insuring the overrides mechanism.

entries.name: register_litellm_models caches JSON definitions without import
entries.description: Custom model definition files are parsed with `json5` and merged into `ModelInfoManager.local_model_metadata`, letting teams extend litellm's catalog without touching aide's package data.

entries.name: GitHub Copilot token exchange populates OPENAI_API_KEY
entries.description: `github_copilot_token_to_open_ai_key` hits the Copilot internal token endpoint, redacts headers in error cases, and writes the returned token into `OPENAI_API_KEY` so Copilot credentials work with OpenAI transports.

entries.name: token_count_for_image normalizes dimensions to price tiles
entries.description: `token_count_for_image` rescales large assets, snaps the short edge to 768px, counts 512x512 tiles, and applies the 170-token tile rate plus 85-token base so multimodal usage charges can be estimated.

entries.name: model-settings.yml maps weak/editor defaults per model
entries.description: `aider/resources/model-settings.yml` enumerates known models with their recommended `weak_model_name` and reminder style (`sys` vs inline). When an unknown model appears, aider consults this table to pick fallbacks for commit summarisation and history rollups.

entries.name: model-metadata.json records token windows and pricing
entries.description: `model-metadata.json` caches provider-specific limitsâ€”input/output tokens, prompt-cache costs, tool support flags, and preferred litellm provider names. Runtime lookups use it to validate settings like reasoning budgets or prompt caching without hitting remote APIs.

entries.name: check_for_dependencies prompts pip installs for Bedrock and Vertex
entries.description: `models.check_for_dependencies` checks prefixes `bedrock/` And `vertex_ai/`, calling `check_pip_install_extra` For `boto3` And `google-cloud-aiplatform`. Tests `tests/basic/test_models.py` mock IO and ensure that calls only occur for the required prefixes, preventing missing dependencies.

entries.name: Model.parse_token_value normalizes human-readable budgets
entries.description: `Model.parse_token_value` accepts numbers, strings with `k`/`M`, trims spaces and converts decimal values to integer tokens. `tests/basic/test_models.py` checks options `8k`, `0.5M`, strings and floats, ensuring that set_thinking_tokens can consume user input without crashing.

entries.name: sanity_check_model reports missing API keys per provider
entries.description: `models.sanity_check_model` collects `missing_keys`, checks the environment and, if necessary, calls `check_for_dependencies` before displaying the status via `io.tool_output`. `tests/basic/test_models.py` mock IO and environment, confirming what the message shows `Set/Not set` and that bogus editor models cause warnings in `sanity_check_models`.

entries.name: GitRepo.commit orchestrates attribution and message generation
entries.description: `projects/Aider/aider/repo.py` forms `GitRepo` with lots of GitPython error handlers and cache `.aiderignore`. Method `commit(...)` collects diffs (`get_diffs`), causes `get_commit_message` to generate text through customized models (`WaitingSpinner`, `prompts.commit_system`), and calculates effective attribution flags: author/committer rename, prefix `aider:` and trailer `Co-authored-by` take into account `--attribute-*` And `--attribute-co-authored-by`. Via context manager `set_git_env` temporarily installed `GIT_AUTHOR_NAME`/`GIT_COMMITTER_NAME`, after which `repo.git.commit` performs `--no-verify` and targeted addition of files. This ensures a consistent commit history between AI- and user-initiated changes.

entries.name: GitRepo.get_diffs handles repos with no commits and staged adds
entries.description: `GitRepo.get_diffs` checks if the active branch has commits; on empty histories it concatenates `git diff --cached` and working-tree diffs while noting added filenames, so users still see changes during the first commit.

entries.name: aiderignore metadata is cached and refreshed on demand
entries.description: `refresh_aider_ignore` monitors the `.aiderignore` timestamp, rebuilds a `PathSpec` only when the file changes, and caches ignore decisions in `ignore_file_cache`, keeping ignore checks fast without missing updates.

entries.name: get_tracked_files caches tree snapshots and merges staged entries
entries.description: `get_tracked_files` builds a cached set of tracked paths per commit, folds in staged index entries, filters with `ignored_file`, and tolerates GitPython errors so chat commands always operate on the trusted file list.

entries.name: set_git_env restores author attribution variables after commits
entries.description: The `set_git_env` context manager temporarily sets `GIT_*` environment variables for attribution and reliably restores prior values (or unsets them) on exit, preventing commit identity tweaks from leaking to the user shell.

entries.name: GitRepo constructor enforces a single git root
entries.description: During init, `GitRepo` resolves candidate paths, probes parent directories with GitPython, and raises when files span multiple repositories so sessions never mix unrelated roots.

entries.name: normalize_path memoizes repo-relative POSIX paths
entries.description: `normalize_path` caches conversions from Git tree entries to repo-relative POSIX strings so ignore checks and diff printing work with consistent canonical names.

entries.name: git_ignored_file defers to Git for ignore status
entries.description: `git_ignored_file` calls `Repo.ignored(path)` and tolerates Git errors, providing an authoritative answer when deciding if a file should enter the chat.

entries.name: Subtree mode skips files outside the working directory
entries.description: When `subtree_only` is true, `ignored_file_raw` compares normalized paths to `Path.cwd()` and ignores anything outside that subtree, protecting monorepos from cross-project edits.

entries.name: get_dirty_files merges staged and unstaged changes
entries.description: `get_dirty_files` runs `git diff --name-only` for both the index and working tree, unions the results, and returns a list so commands have a cheap view of pending changes.

entries.name: path_in_repo reuses the tracked file cache
entries.description: `path_in_repo` pulls the cached tracked file set from `get_tracked_files`, normalizes the candidate path, and checks membership so subsequent operations only touch versioned files.

entries.name: get_head_commit_message returns a default on empty repos
entries.description: `get_head_commit_message` catches missing head commits and returns the caller-provided default string so prompts can include commit info even before the first commit exists.

entries.name: sanity_check_repo blocks unsupported git states before launch
entries.description: `aider/main.py::sanity_check_repo` checks that the repository has a working tree, catches exceptions `repo.get_tracked_files`, recognizes messages about index > v2 and offers the command `git update-index --index-version=2`. Test `tests/basic/test_sanity_check_repo.py` simulates bare, corrupt and index-v3 scenarios, confirming that warnings and links to documentation are displayed correctly.

entries.name: Coder.create reuses prior coder state when switching formats
entries.description: `Coder.create` clones `from_coder.original_kwargs`, summarizes `done_messages` when the edit format changes, and carries over commands, token counters, watchers, and ignore lists so mode switches keep the ongoing session intact.

entries.name: Coder.run loops user input with reflection-aware preprocessing
entries.description: `Coder.run` feeds prompts through `io.get_input`, respects placeholders injected by watchers, and `run_one` handles command preprocessing, reflection retries via `self.reflected_message`, and double-CTRL+C handling to keep the chat loop resilient.

entries.name: send_message streams responses with spinner and litellm retry policy
entries.description: `send_message` formats messages, starts a `WaitingSpinner`, streams markdown when enabled, and catches `LiteLLMExceptions` to back off exponentially up to `RETRY_TIMEOUT`, surfacing context-limit guidance when retries fail.

entries.name: Preprocessing invites adding mentioned URLs to the chat
entries.description: `Coder.check_for_urls` finds HTTP(S) links, prompts with `ConfirmGroup` to import them, routes approvals through `Commands.cmd_web`, and `check_and_open_urls` offers browser links on exceptions, keeping external context in sync.

entries.name: get_images_message packages images and PDFs for vision models
entries.description: `get_images_message` checks `main_model.info` for vision/PDF support, base64 encodes attachments into `data:` URLs with appropriate MIME hints and returns a structured message so compatible models receive inline visuals.

entries.name: lint_edited surfaces per-file lint diagnostics after responses
entries.description: `Coder.lint_edited` iterates recent filenames, runs `self.linter.lint` on each absolute path, and emits aggregated warnings through IO so auto-lint/test workflows show actionable feedback right after a reply.

entries.name: ArchitectCoder hands plans to the editor model automatically
entries.description: `architect_coder.ArchitectCoder.reply_completed` confirms the plan, spins up a new editor coder via `Coder.create` with the architect's editor model, runs it on the generated instructions, and copies back total cost and commit hashes for a seamless two-phase workflow.

entries.name: get_file_mentions spots basenames to suggest chat additions
entries.description: `Coder.get_file_mentions` normalizes words, matches both full paths and unique basenames not already tracked, and returns candidate filenames so the assistant can ask to add missing files when they are referenced in conversation.

entries.name: sanity_check_messages enforces alternating user/assistant turns
entries.description: `sendchat.sanity_check_messages` walks the message list, raises when two consecutive roles match, and requires the last non-system entry to be from the user before sending anything to the model.

entries.name: ensure_alternating_roles inserts empty turns to repair malformed logs
entries.description: `ensure_alternating_roles` scans the message stream and injects blank assistant or user stubs whenever it encounters duplicate roles, allowing aider to recover from manual edits or custom scripts.

entries.name: AskCoder routes read-only Q&A through AskPrompts without editing files
entries.description: `AskCoder` inherits `Coder` with `edit_format="ask"` and swaps in `AskPrompts`, providing a model mode that answers questions but never touches the working tree.

entries.name: Commands.clone preserves IO and voice state during coder swaps
entries.description: `Commands.clone` constructs a new Commands with the current IO, parser, voice settings, verbosity, editor, and read-only filenames so mode switches reuse the same command surface without mutating the original instance.

entries.name: cmd_undo validates history before rewriting the last commit
entries.description: `cmd_undo` ensures the latest commit was made by aider, checks it is not pushed to origin, verifies touched files are clean, restores each file with `git checkout HEAD~1 <file>`, and finally performs `git reset --soft HEAD~1`, reporting both removed and current commits.

entries.name: cmd_run controls when command output enters the chat
entries.description: `cmd_run` executes shell commands through `run_cmd`, estimates output tokens with the active model, prompts before adding logs (or auto-adds for non-zero exits), and wraps the result with `prompts.run_output` so diagnostics are chat-ready.

entries.name: cmd_tokens audits context usage and highlights relief options
entries.description: `cmd_tokens` recomputes system prompts, chat history, repo-map content, and file payloads, displays per-component token counts, and suggests actions like `/drop` or `--map-tokens` when the context window is near exhaustion.

entries.name: /add resolves globs, honors ignores, and can create files
entries.description: `cmd_add` expands quoted globs relative to the repo, skips paths blocked by `repo.ignored_file`, offers to create missing files after confirmation, and upgrades read-only entries to editable chat files when they exist in the repository.

entries.name: Commands.run resolves slash commands and the ! alias
entries.description: `run()` handles bang-prefixed shell commands, matches partial slash commands, emits analytics events, and reports ambiguity before delegating to `do_run`.

entries.name: do_run centralizes lookup with git-safe error handling
entries.description: `do_run` normalizes hyphenated names to method suffixes and catches `ANY_GIT_ERROR`, surfacing tool errors instead of tracebacks when git operations fail inside commands.

entries.name: /chat-mode lists presets and coder formats
entries.description: `cmd_chat_mode` merges a curated help menu with dynamically discovered coder edit formats, prints descriptions, and raises `SwitchCoder` with the chosen target.

entries.name: /web lazily installs Playwright and scrapes content
entries.description: `cmd_web` optionally installs Playwright, constructs a shared `Scraper` with the current verify_ssl setting, and injects the fetched markdown as a user message plus acknowledgement.

entries.name: /reset clears chat history and tracked files
entries.description: The command invokes `_drop_all_files` and `_clear_chat_history`, preserving original read-only paths while wiping the active edit set so operators can restart without leaving the process.

entries.name: /drop supports globbing and read-only removal
entries.description: `cmd_drop` expands globs, uses substring and `os.path.samefile` checks for read-only entries, and removes any matches from both editable and read-only file sets.

entries.name: /git wraps subprocess with a no-op editor
entries.description: `cmd_git` prepends `git` to the argument string, forces `GIT_EDITOR=true`, and streams combined stdout and stderr back to the tool channel so git plumbing runs without opening an editor.

entries.name: Scripting API test proves repeated coder.run invocations
entries.description: `tests/basic/test_scripting.py` opens `GitTemporaryDirectory`, starts an empty file and using a mock `Coder.send` checks that two calls `coder.run(...)` return the line "Changes applied successfully.". This demonstrates how the built-in scripting API allows you to automate a series of queries without manual input.

entries.name: RepoMap caches ranked results based on refresh policy and inputs
entries.description: `RepoMap.get_ranked_tags_map` creates cache keys from chat files, other files, token budgets, and mention sets, honours `refresh` modes (`manual`, `files`, `auto`), and reuses cached maps when recomputation would be expensive.

entries.name: Repo map boosts root configs via filter_important_files
entries.description: Before ranking `get_ranked_tags_map_uncached` adds tuples from `special.filter_important_files`so that README, configs and CI manifests are included in the map even without graph weights. `tests/basic/test_special.py` anchors the expected list of important names so filter changes won't break priorities.

entries.name: to_tree renders TreeContext snippets while trimming long lines
entries.description: `RepoMap.to_tree` groups ranked tags by relative filename, uses cached `TreeContext` objects from `render_tree` to include surrounding code, and truncates each output line to 100 characters to keep repo-map summaries readable.

entries.name: filter_important_files prioritises repo scaffolding for context
entries.description: `special.filter_important_files` compares paths with a curated list of documentation, configs, dependencies and CI files so that the repo map highlights artifacts with high value. `tests/basic/test_special.py` checks case, relative paths and `.github/workflows`, keeping heuristics in good shape.

entries.name: RepoMap caches tag captures keyed by file mtime
entries.description: `RepoMap.get_tags` looks up the disk cache by filename, compares the stored `mtime`, and either returns cached captures or recomputes `get_tags_raw` before writing `{'mtime': ..., 'data': ...}`.

entries.name: tags_cache_error rebuilds sqlite cache or falls back to dict
entries.description: `RepoMap.tags_cache_error` deletes the cache directory, tries to instantiate a new `Cache`, and if SQLite keeps failing it warns the user and replaces `TAGS_CACHE` with a plain dict so repo map generation continues.

entries.name: get_tags_raw combines tree-sitter queries with Pygments fallbacks
entries.description: `get_tags_raw` loads `.scm` queries to emit definition/reference captures, and when a language only yields defs it tokenises the source with Pygments to synthesize reference tags so PageRank still links usages.

entries.name: get_ranked_tags builds personalization from mentions and paths
entries.description: `get_ranked_tags` assigns base personalization, boosts chat files, matches `mentioned_fnames`, and checks path components plus basenames against `mentioned_idents` before passing the vector to `networkx.pagerank`.

entries.name: Identifier heuristics scale edge weights before PageRank
entries.description: Within `get_ranked_tags`, identifiers mentioned by the user or matching long snake/kebab/camel case get a x10 boost, leading underscores and highly defined symbols are dampened, and references originating from chat files get a 50x multiplier to favour nearby code.

entries.name: RepoMap.token_count samples long files to estimate tokens
entries.description: `RepoMap.token_count` slices every Nth line from large files, counts tokens for the sample, and scales the result so repo maps can budget context cheaply without running full tokenisation on megabyte files.

entries.name: RepoMap expands token budget when no files are in chat
entries.description: `get_repo_map` multiplies `max_map_tokens` by `map_mul_no_files` (capped by `max_context_window - 4096`) when the chat is empty, giving a broader repository overview on first prompt.

entries.name: get_rel_fname tolerates cross-drive paths on Windows
entries.description: `RepoMap.get_rel_fname` wraps `os.path.relpath` and falls back to the absolute name when Windows drive letters differ, avoiding crashes when the working tree spans multiple mounts.

entries.name: get_tags_raw runs tree-sitter queries to collect defs and refs
entries.description: `get_tags_raw` selects the language-specific `.scm` query, executes it with tree-sitter or tsl-pack parsers, and yields `Tag` tuples for definitions and references that seed the repo map ranking.

entries.name: Missing files generate warnings but keep the repo map running
entries.description: `RepoMap.get_mtime` catches `FileNotFoundError`, emits a tool warning with the path, and returns `None` so callers skip stale entries without blowing up the mapping pass.

entries.name: RepoMap bumps tag cache version when tree-sitter pack is active
entries.description: `RepoMap` sets `CACHE_VERSION = 4` whenever `USING_TSL_PACK` is true, isolating cache directories so mixed installations with bundled tree-sitter grammars never reuse incompatible tag caches.

entries.name: Sample code base fixture stresses repo-map class detection
entries.description: `tests/fixtures/sample-code-base/sample.py` creates classes `Car` And `Garage` with methods `accelerate`, `brake`, `list_cars`, helping to check that repo map and tree-sitter find methods, attributes and print. This mini-base is used in documentation and tests to demonstrate standard code patterns.

entries.name: Python tag queries mark definitions and call sites
entries.description: `python-tags.scm` tags module-level assignments as constants, captures class and function definitions, and treats any call node's function identifier as a reference. This lets the repo map surface both symbol declarations and usages when parsing Python projects via tree-sitter.

entries.name: JavaScript tags align doc comments with functions
entries.description: The JavaScript query associates preceding block comments with classes, methods, and arrow-function assignments, while normalising every detected declaration under a single identifier capture. It also records constructor calls and excludes `require` invocations so repo maps link real symbol usages without pulling in module loaders.

entries.name: Go tags capture docstrings, methods, and imports
entries.description: `go-tags.scm` strips `//` doc comments into definition metadata, differentiates free functions from receiver methods, and marks identifiers in selector expressions as call references. It also emits type, package, and import captures so the repo map links struct declarations and module usage within Go codebases.

entries.name: Rust tag rules span traits, macros, and impls
entries.description: The Rust query enumerates ADT declarations, traits, modules, and macro definitions, and records both identifier and field-expression calls. It also tags `impl` blocks as implementation references so aide r's PageRank graph can connect trait implementations and macro invocations to the symbols they depend on.

entries.name: Java tags link class hierarchies and invocations
entries.description: `java-tags.scm` marks class, interface, and method declarations, then mirrors `method_invocation` names and constructor expressions as call references. It additionally records superclass type identifiers, allowing repo maps to connect inheritance chains alongside regular method usage.

entries.name: C# tags cover namespaces and generic constraints
entries.description: The C# tag rules capture namespace declarations, classes, interfaces, and methods. They also watch base lists and generic constraint clauses so base types become reference nodes, ensuring repo maps surface inheritance and constraint relationships for C# projects.

entries.name: Swift tags recognise initialisers, subscripts, and properties
entries.description: `swift-tags.scm` tags class and protocol names, then walks class and protocol bodies to capture methods, `init`/`deinit`, and subscript signatures. Separate captures mark property patterns, so the repo map extracts the full API surface when scanning Swift sources.

entries.name: Ruby tags bind documentation to classes and methods
entries.description: The Ruby query strips leading `#` comments into doc captures, attaches them to method or class definitions, and rejects built-in control forms. It also records module declarations and excludes common loader calls, keeping repo maps focused on real Ruby APIs and aliases.

entries.name: Elixir tags separate def* macros from true call sites
entries.description: `elixir-tags.scm` recognises `def*` forms as definitions for modules and functions, while explicitly ignoring kernel macros and module attributes. Identifier and pipeline targets become call references, letting repo maps track Elixir function usage without mistaking macro keywords for dependencies.

entries.name: Properties tags tie key definitions to substitutions
entries.description: The `.properties` query is minimal by design: it marks each key node as a property definition and captures `${key}` substitutions as references. That gives the repo map enough structure to visualise configuration dependencies inside JVM-style properties files.

entries.name: Tree-sitter Arduino tags capture functions and calls
entries.description: `arduino-tags.scm` marks each `function_declarator` identifier as a function definition and tags every `call_expression` callee, so Arduino sketches surface callable symbols in the repo map despite sharing C grammar primitives.

entries.name: Tree-sitter C tags expose struct, enum, and typedef symbols
entries.description: `c-tags.scm` promotes struct/union type identifiers, `typedef`/`enum_specifier` declarations, and `function_declarator` identifiers to tag definitions, letting repo map inventory classic C types alongside function entry points.

entries.name: Tree-sitter Chatito tags link intents, slots, and aliases
entries.description: `chatito-tags.scm` emits definition tags for `intent_def`, `slot_def`, and `alias_def` nodes and mirrors them with reference tags in `slot_ref` and `alias_ref`, preserving the DSL graph for Chatito training data.

entries.name: Tree-sitter Clojure tags recognize def* forms and calls
entries.description: `clojure-tags.scm` finds list forms whose leading symbol matches `^def` macros, tagging the second symbol as a definition, and falls back to tagging every bare `sym_lit` as a call to capture dynamic function usage.

entries.name: Tree-sitter Common Lisp tags filter macros and class forms
entries.description: `commonlisp-tags.scm` tags `defun_header` names as function definitions while screening out lambda lists, and adds `defclass`/`make-instance` class tags so the repo map distinguishes constructors from macro scaffolding.

entries.name: Tree-sitter C++ tags capture namespace-qualified methods
entries.description: `cpp-tags.scm` upgrades `class_specifier`, `struct_specifier`, and namespace-qualified `function_declarator` nodes to definition tags, ensuring repo map records templated methods and enum types alongside free functions.

entries.name: Tree-sitter D tags span modules, constructors, and templates
entries.description: `d-tags.scm` elevates module declarations, class/struct/union names, and constructor/destructor tokens, and tags both plain and templated `call_expression` identifiers so D codebases keep module-level navigation in repo map.

entries.name: Tree-sitter Dart tags cover class APIs and cascade sends
entries.description: `dart-tags.scm` labels class, enum, mixin, extension, and factory signatures as definitions, and treats cascade send chains plus `new` expressions as class references so repo map understands Dart's cascade syntax.

entries.name: Tree-sitter Emacs Lisp treats macros as callable definitions
entries.description: `elisp-tags.scm` tags both `function_definition` and `macro_definition` symbols as function definitions so repo map doesn't hide macro entry points when scanning elisp helpers.

entries.name: Tree-sitter Elm tags exported functions and union types
entries.description: `elm-tags.scm` marks lower-case `value_declaration` identifiers as functions, upper-case `type_declaration`/`union_variant` names as types, and records `module_declaration` names, tying repo map entries to Elm exposure lists.

entries.name: Tree-sitter Gleam tags capture remote module pipelines
entries.description: `gleam-tags.scm` tags module imports, `function`/`external_function` names, and pipeline `|>` operators that reference remote calls, while also surfacing type and constructor definitions for Gleam projects.

entries.name: Tree-sitter Lua tags infer table field functions and methods
entries.description: `lua-tags.scm` treats assigned `function_definition` values and table constructor fields as function definitions and distinguishes `method_index_expression` calls, giving repo map visibility into Lua's dynamic method style.

entries.name: Tree-sitter MATLAB tags follow class blocks and command calls
entries.description: `matlab-tags.scm` tags `class_definition` and `function_definition` identifiers plus command-form invocations, ensuring repo map indexes both OO constructs and script-style call sites.

entries.name: Tree-sitter OCaml tags propagate doc-stripped bindings
entries.description: `ocaml-tags.scm` strips doc comments before tagging `module_definition`, `value_definition`, `external` declarations, operators, and class/method bindings so repo map reflects OCaml signatures and piped calls.

entries.name: Tree-sitter OCaml interface tags expose .mli signatures
entries.description: `ocaml_interface-tags.scm` tags module, class, type, and value specifications (plus constructor and field names) in interface files, mirroring the exported surface area for repo map queries.

entries.name: Tree-sitter Pony tags enumerate actors, traits, and calls
entries.description: `pony-tags.scm` covers class/actor/primitive identifiers, trait interfaces, constructor/behavior methods, and generic/member call expressions so repo map can follow Pony's capability-oriented dispatch.

entries.name: Tree-sitter R tags detect assignment-based function exports
entries.description: `r-tags.scm` recognizes `<-` and `=` assignments whose rhs is a `function_definition` and tracks namespace-qualified calls, which keeps repo map aligned with R's export patterns.

entries.name: Tree-sitter Racket tags distinguish define forms and calls
entries.description: `racket-tags.scm` pinpoints `define`/`define/contract` lists to tag function heads and treats every other list-leading symbol as a call, producing minimal yet useful navigation over macros.

entries.name: Tree-sitter Solidity tags capture contracts, events, and emits
entries.description: `solidity-tags.scm` tags contract/interface/library names, function definitions, inheritance specifiers, `emit` targets, and `call_expression` members so repo map understands Solidity's declarative surface.

entries.name: Tree-sitter udev tags wire LABEL/GOTO and ENV lookups
entries.description: `udev-tags.scm` tags `LABEL=` assignments as label definitions, `GOTO=` as label references, and tracks `ENV{}` variables in both assignments and matches, making udev rules navigable in the repo map.

entries.name: Python fixture supplies class/method shapes for tree-sitter
entries.description: `tests/fixtures/languages/python/test.py` specifies the class `Person` with methods and constants `DEFAULT_NAME`, `MAX_AGE`, which provides the tree-sitter repo map with typical definitions. The repo-map tests use this file to check that Python rules find classes, functions, and imports.

entries.name: FileWatcher merges gitignore patterns and size guards
entries.description: `load_gitignores` builds a `PathSpec` from project `.gitignore` files plus built-ins, and `filter_func` skips paths outside the repo, ignored directories, and files over 1â€¯MB before checking for AI comments.

entries.name: process_changes converts AI comments into watch prompts
entries.description: `FileWatcher.process_changes` aggregates changed files, extracts `AI!`/`AI?` through `get_ai_comments`, picks up `watch_code_prompt` against `watch_ask_prompt` and collects secretions through `TreeContext`. Fixture `tests/fixtures/watch.py` and tests `test_watch.py` cover different cases and suffixes, confirming the correctness of the parsing.

entries.name: ClipboardWatcher pre-fills chat input from system clipboard
entries.description: `copypaste.ClipboardWatcher` polls `pyperclip`, updates `io.placeholder` with newline-wrapped content on change, and calls `io.interrupt_input()` so fresh clipboard snippets are ready for the next prompt.

entries.name: FileWatcher.get_roots_to_watch filters ignored directories with fallback
entries.description: `FileWatcher.get_roots_to_watch` lists top-level paths not matched by the gitignore spec and falls back to the repo root when every entry would be skipped, ensuring watcher coverage even in heavily ignored projects.

entries.name: FileWatcher.start manages a background watchfiles thread with stop events
entries.description: `FileWatcher.start` resets `changed_files`, spins up a daemon thread that calls `watch_files`, and pairs with `stop()` to signal the `threading.Event`, preventing stray watchers when the chat loop finishes.

entries.name: FileWatcher hooks into the coder and preloads ignores
entries.description: The constructor stores coder IO, builds a `PathSpec` from any gitignore paths, and assigns `coder.io.file_watcher = self` so the chat loop can manage the watcher lifecycle.

entries.name: handle_changes caches paths and interrupts the REPL
entries.description: `handle_changes` converts watch tuples into absolute `Path` strings, updates the pending set, and calls `io.interrupt_input()` so the REPL can respond to AI annotations immediately.

entries.name: watch_files drives watchfiles with stop events and filters
entries.description: `watch_files` gathers candidate roots, passes them to `watch` with the custom filter, respects `stop_event`, and keeps quiet unless verbose debugging is enabled.

entries.name: ai_comment_pattern catches AI markers across comment styles
entries.description: The compiled regex accepts hash, slash, hyphen, and semicolon comment prefixes and looks for `AI!` or `AI?` at either end, supporting Python, JS, Lisp, and shell-style annotations.

entries.name: test_gitignore_patterns covers built-in ignore defaults
entries.description: The unit test asserts that `load_gitignores` matches editor backups, caches, node_modules, and custom patterns, guarding the bundled ignore list against regressions.

entries.name: test_ai_comment_pattern verifies multi-language detection
entries.description: Fixture-based tests ensure `get_ai_comments` finds the expected counts and action markers across Python, JavaScript, question, and Lisp samples, proving the regex handles diverse syntax.

entries.name: test_get_roots_to_watch ensures ignored directories drop out
entries.description: The test sets up temporary directories and a .gitignore to confirm `get_roots_to_watch` returns the surviving entries plus the gitignore file, matching runtime fallback logic.

entries.name: watch.py fixture exercises all AI comment permutations
entries.description: `tests/fixtures/watch.py` contains a sequence of comments `#ai`, `#AI!`, `#ai inside`, showing different registers, exclamations and numbers. Watcher tests use this file to ensure that `ai_comment_pattern` does not miss complex combinations.

entries.name: ChatSummary splits and recurses until summaries fit the token cap
entries.description: `ChatSummary.summarize_real` tokenizes messages, finds a split that keeps the tail under half the budget, enforces assistant boundaries, and recursively summarizes head and tail (up to depth 3) until the result fits within `max_tokens`.

entries.name: summarize_all formats role-labelled Markdown for the summarizer model
entries.description: `ChatSummary.summarize_all` emits `# USER`/`# ASSISTANT` sections, feeds them with `prompts.summarize`, and wraps the reply with `prompts.summary_prefix`, ensuring future coders inherit a concise user-voiced history.

entries.name: tokenize caches per-message token counts for summary decisions
entries.description: `ChatSummary.tokenize` stores `(tokens, message)` tuples using each model's `token_count`, letting `too_big` and recursive summarization reuse sizes without recounting the entire conversation.

entries.name: ChatSummary constructor enforces a model list and token counter
entries.description: `ChatSummary.__init__` requires at least one model, wraps singletons into a list, and captures the first model's `token_count` callable for later size checks.

entries.name: too_big sums cached token counts before summarising
entries.description: `ChatSummary.too_big` reuses `tokenize` results, sums the stored token counts, and compares against `max_tokens` to decide when recursive summarisation should kick in.

entries.name: summarize appends an assistant acknowledgement when needed
entries.description: `ChatSummary.summarize` delegates to `summarize_real` and, if the resulting list ends with a user message, appends an assistant 'Ok.' so conversations stay well formed.

entries.name: summarize_real reserves input tokens before trimming the head
entries.description: `summarize_real` looks up `model.info['max_input_tokens']` (falling back to 4096), subtracts 512 as a safety buffer, and only keeps head messages until the budget is reached before calling `summarize_all`.

entries.name: summarize_all falls back across models and surfaces failures
entries.description: `summarize_all` iterates the configured models, calling `simple_send_with_retries` until one succeeds, prepends `prompts.summary_prefix` to the reply, and raises a `ValueError` if every model fails.

entries.name: summarize_real backs up to the nearest assistant message
entries.description: Before splitting the conversation, `ChatSummary.summarize_real` walks backward to ensure the head ends on an assistant role, preventing truncated user prompts from being summarised without a reply.

entries.name: Recursive summarisation stops after depth 3 or fewer than four messages
entries.description: `ChatSummary.summarize_real` short-circuits when `len(messages) <= 4` or recursion depth exceeds three, falling back to `summarize_all` so tiny conversations return quickly.

entries.name: summarize_all prepends prompts.summary_prefix to user summaries
entries.description: After receiving model output, `summarize_all` adds `prompts.summary_prefix` so downstream prompts recognise the recap as prior discussion rather than fresh instructions.

entries.name: summarize_all wraps content in a dedicated system prompt
entries.description: The helper builds a two-message payload with `role='system'` pointing to `prompts.summarize` and a user payload listing each turn, keeping summarisation behaviour aligned with prompt engineering across models.

entries.name: summarize_all raises ValueError when every model fails
entries.description: If all configured models throw, `summarize_all` surfaces a `ValueError('summarizer unexpectedly failed for all models')`, making error handling explicit for callers like `ChatSummary.summarize`.

entries.name: Commit system prompt enforces Conventional Commits style
entries.description: `prompts.commit_system` instructs the assistant to emit `<type>: <description>` messages under 72 characters, in imperative mood, and interpolates `{language_instruction}` so commit automation stays consistent and localized.

entries.name: Summaries are written from the user perspective without code fences
entries.description: `prompts.summarize` mandates that summaries start with â€œI asked youâ€¦â€, avoid ``` fences, and include filenames and functions, producing user-voiced rollups that stay actionable.

entries.name: Watch prompts distinguish AI edits from questions
entries.description: `watch_prompts.watch_code_prompt` tells the assistant to follow AI-marked edits and remove the comments, while `watch_prompts.watch_ask_prompt` routes AI questions through `/ask`, giving watcher-triggered flows clear intent.

entries.name: run_output template embeds command transcripts for review
entries.description: `prompts.run_output` wraps command invocations and outputs in Markdown, matching `/run` and `/test` so captured shell logs are cleanly presented inside the chat.

entries.name: undo_command_reply warns users after git reset of AI edits
entries.description: `prompts.undo_command_reply` explains that aider ran `git reset --hard HEAD~1` and advises the user to pause before retrying, reinforcing the workflow whenever `/undo` fires.

entries.name: added_files prompt reminds users to share remaining files explicitly
entries.description: `prompts.added_files` lists the filenames aider just added to the chat and nudges the user to mention other required edits, keeping multi-file sessions on track.

entries.name: CoderPrompts centralizes shared guardrails for all edit formats
entries.description: `base_prompts.CoderPrompts` defines the lazy vs overeager reminders, common file-sharing boilerplate, shell command hints, and the generic repo-map advisory strings reused by every coder prompt class.

entries.name: ArchitectPrompts produce plan-only responses for editor handoff
entries.description: `ArchitectPrompts.main_system` frames the model as an architect who must describe changes, explicitly forbid dumping whole files, and always reply in `{language}` so the downstream editor coder can execute the plan verbatim.

entries.name: AskPrompts keep answers concise and analysis-only
entries.description: `AskPrompts.main_system` positions the coder as a code analyst who answers questions about supplied files, returning responses in `{language}` and only sketching code edits briefly when absolutely necessary.

entries.name: ContextPrompts enforce two-part lists of files vs related symbols
entries.description: `ContextPrompts.main_system` tells the model to return a bulleted list of files that must be modified, plus a separate list of relevant symbols elsewhere, and the try-again message nudges it to re-evaluate when the repo map changes.

entries.name: EditBlockPrompts drill the SEARCH/REPLACE workflow step-by-step
entries.description: `EditBlockPrompts` instruct the model to ask for files not yet shared, outline changes, then emit fenced *SEARCH/REPLACE blocks* with `<<<<<<< SEARCH` / `=======` / `>>>>>>> REPLACE` markers, including multi-block rename guidance.

entries.name: EditBlockFencedPrompts embed file paths inside the fenced diff
entries.description: The fenced variant rewrites example messages so the path appears inside the fenced block, tightening formatting for editors that expect ```````file```` style fences while reusing the SEARCH/REPLACE rule reminder.

entries.name: EditorEditBlockPrompts strip shell command suggestions for GUI mode
entries.description: `EditorEditBlockPrompts` reuse the search/replace script but blank out `shell_cmd_prompt`, reminders, and rename tips so IDE integrations donâ€™t show terminal-only guidance.

entries.name: EditorDiffFencedPrompts inherit fenced format with editor-specific silencing
entries.description: `editor_diff_fenced_prompts` keeps the fenced SEARCH/REPLACE examples but clears shell command hints and go-ahead tips, matching the editor-focused coder that emits fenced diffs only.

entries.name: EditorWholeFilePrompts insist on returning entire updated files
entries.description: `EditorWholeFilePrompts.main_system` tells the coder to output a copy of each changed file and relies on the WholeFile prompts to enforce the filename + fenced full-content listing format.

entries.name: UnifiedDiffPrompts spell out diff-`-U0` etiquette for coders
entries.description: `udiff_prompts.UnifiedDiffPrompts` outline how to structure hunks without timestamps, force `@@` headers, and add shell suggestions, keeping generated unified diffs patchable by the userâ€™s tooling.

entries.name: WholeFilePrompts define the filename+fence listing contract
entries.description: `WholeFilePrompts.system_reminder` requires each response to start with the raw path line, then fenced full contents, and warns never to elide code with ellipses, which keeps copy/paste updates deterministic.

entries.name: Shell prompt helpers enumerate when to suggest terminal commands
entries.description: `coders.shell` provides `shell_cmd_prompt`/`shell_cmd_reminder` templates listing scenarios (tests, CLI programs, dependency installs) and interpolates `{platform}` so edit prompts stay OS-aware.

entries.name: EditBlock function prompts enforce replace_lines usage
entries.description: `EditBlockFunctionPrompts` instructs models to answer exclusively via the `replace_lines` function, provides boilerplate prefixes when no files are shared, and reminds the LLM to defer repo summaries as read-only context. It keeps editblock coders tightly aligned with the function-calling interface.

entries.name: Patch prompts spell out V4A diff contract
entries.description: `PatchPrompts` extends editblock guidance with a numbered checklist: ask for file access when needed, summarise planned changes, and emit consolidated V4A diff blocks with `*** Begin Patch`/`*** End Patch`. The reminder forbids duplicate file blocks and reiterates context rules so the V4A parser can apply patches safely.

entries.name: Single whole-file prompts lock responses to write_file
entries.description: `SingleWholeFileFunctionPrompts` tailor the system message for single-file updates, requiring the model to respond only through the `write_file` function. The prompt suppresses repo summaries and clarifies that no files are shared until the user adds one, reducing accidental multi-file edits.

entries.name: Unified diff simple reminder emphasises minimal hunks
entries.description: `UnifiedDiffSimplePrompts` inherits the udiff format but reiterates that every changed line must appear with `-`/`+` markers and suggests `--- /dev/null` for new files. The stripped-down reminder helps weaker models produce apply-ready patches without extra docstrings.

entries.name: Linter chains basic checks, compile, and flake8 fatal rules
entries.description: `Linter.py` wires `py_lint` to combine regex heuristics, `lint_python_compile` tracebacks, and a focused `flake8` invocation (fatal codes only), returning unified `LintResult`s with line numbers.

entries.name: cmd_lint loops over dirty files and applies fixes via a clone coder
entries.description: `cmd_lint` gathers in-chat or dirty files, runs `self.coder.linter.lint`, prompts before fixing, spins up a temporary coder clone to apply model-driven fixes per file, and auto-commits when `auto_commits` is enabled.

entries.name: cmd_test auto-adds failing command output to the chat
entries.description: `cmd_test` reuses `/run` but automatically adds output when the exit status is non-zero, and accepts callable hooks as well as shell strings so failing tests surface in conversation without manual copying.

entries.name: Linter.set_linter supports per-language and global overrides
entries.description: `Linter.set_linter` registers a callable for a specific language or stores a catch-all command in `all_lint_cmd`, letting the same instance route linting between custom and built-in tooling.

entries.name: Linter.lint auto-detects language and formats combined output
entries.description: `Linter.lint` computes a repo-relative path, uses `filename_to_lang` to choose the language, falls back to `all_lint_cmd` or the registered callable, and wraps the result with a '# Fix any errors...' preamble plus tree context.

entries.name: basic_lint uses tree-sitter to surface syntax errors
entries.description: `basic_lint` skips languages without support (like TypeScript), loads a parser via `get_parser`, walks for nodes marked `ERROR`/`is_missing`, and returns the offending line numbers inside a `LintResult`.

entries.name: tree_context highlights lines of interest with TreeContext
entries.description: `tree_context` instantiates `TreeContext` with line numbers, calls `add_lines_of_interest`, and formats output prefixed with 'See relevant line(s)...' so offending lines are marked with block indicators in the lint report.

entries.name: find_filenames_and_linenums maps lint output back to files
entries.description: `find_filenames_and_linenums` builds a regex from candidate filenames, captures `name:line` occurrences, and returns a mapping so external lint command output can be converted into precise `LintResult` line lists.

entries.name: Analytics tests guard opt-in, persistence, and sampling
entries.description: `tests/basic/test_analytics.py` flips `Analytics.enable/disable`, asserts PostHog capture and JSONL logging, validates UUID-based sampling via `is_uuid_in_percentage`, and ensures telemetry prompts stop once opt-out is persisted.

entries.name: Model AWS credential tests enforce AWS_PROFILE heuristics
entries.description: `tests/basic/test_aws_credentials.py` patches `litellm.validate_environment` to show that Bedrock and `us.anthropic` models treat `AWS_PROFILE` as satisfying missing keys while non-Bedrock variants still report `AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID`/`AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY` gaps.

entries.name: Coder tests cover file permissions, mentions, and dirty tracking
entries.description: `tests/basic/test_coder.py` exercises `Coder.allowed_to_edit` prompts, duplicate basename handling, dirty file detection, and filename mentions so chat expansions never add unintended files without confirmation.

entries.name: Commands tests validate /add, /copy, and clipboard fallbacks
entries.description: `tests/basic/test_commands.py` creates temporary repos to assert glob handling, `/add` file creation, `/copy` clipboard previews, and error propagation when pyperclip fails, protecting chat command ergonomics.

entries.name: Editor tests ensure VISUAL/EDITOR discovery and pipe flows
entries.description: `tests/basic/test_editor.py` simulates platform defaults, environment precedence, `write_temp_file` naming, and `pipe_editor` cleanup to guarantee shell-editor integration works across Windows, macOS, and Linux.

entries.name: LiteLLM exception tests map retry semantics
entries.description: `tests/basic/test_exceptions.py` loads `LiteLLMExceptions`, verifies tuple exports, and checks authentication, rate-limit, context-window, and OpenRouter errors map to `ExInfo` with appropriate retry flags and descriptions.

entries.name: ChatSummary tests assert token windows and fallback models
entries.description: `tests/basic/test_history.py` feeds synthetic transcripts to `ChatSummary` to ensure `too_big`, `tokenize`, and `summarize_all` respect model token limits and fall back to a second summarizer when the primary fails.

entries.name: InputOutput tests cover line endings, NO_COLOR, and autocompletion
entries.description: `tests/basic/test_io.py` checks newline validation, color sanitising, dumb terminal detection, `AutoCompleter` command/file suggestions, and directory error handling to keep the console UX robust.

entries.name: Linter tests guard runner quoting and stderr propagation
entries.description: `tests/basic/test_linter.py` configures in-memory linters, verifies relative path resolution, Windows fallbacks, and subprocess return handling (including special chars), ensuring lint output is captured without crashes.

entries.name: Main CLI tests bootstrap repos, config layering, and gitignore
entries.description: `tests/basic/test_main.py` spins up temporary repos to assert `main()` respects `--no-git`, auto-creates files, reads `.aider.conf.yml` toggles, adds `.aider*` to gitignore, and honours `--add-gitignore-files` flags.

entries.name: ModelInfoManager tests pin SSL toggles and lazy cache loads
entries.description: `tests/basic/test_model_info_manager.py` patches `requests.get` to ensure `_update_cache` passes `verify_ssl`, respects `set_verify_ssl(False)`, and lazily reuses on-disk cache without redundant network calls.

entries.name: Onboarding tests cover PKCE, OpenRouter tiers, and key priority
entries.description: `tests/basic/test_onboarding.py` mocks OpenRouter APIs to check free vs paid tier fallbacks, validates PKCE verifier/challenge generation, port probing, and environment-variable precedence when auto-selecting default models.

entries.name: OpenRouter tests ensure cached pricing feeds ModelInfoManager
entries.description: `tests/basic/test_openrouter.py` swaps out network calls so `OpenRouterModelManager` reads cached JSON pricing and `ModelInfoManager` falls back to it when litellm lacks metadata for OpenRouter-prefixed models.

entries.name: GitRepo tests cover diff encodings and commit prompts
entries.description: `tests/basic/test_repo.py` manipulates temporary repos to ensure `get_diffs` handles staged vs working changes, non-UTF encodings, detached HEADs, and checks commit message generation with multiple models and prompts.

entries.name: RepoMap tests validate refresh modes and tag ranking
entries.description: `tests/basic/test_repomap.py` and `tests/basic/test_find_or_blocks.py` assert repo maps cache file tags, respect `refresh="files"` vs `force_refresh`, and keep markdown search/replace extraction aligned with chat history fixtures.

entries.name: run_cmd test ensures exit codes and stdout capture
entries.description: `tests/basic/test_run_cmd.py` executes `echo` through `run_cmd` and asserts a zero exit plus trimmed output, confirming the helper returns both status and text for downstream tooling.

entries.name: Sendchat tests cover retryable errors and role alternation
entries.description: `tests/basic/test_sendchat.py` simulates litellm rate limits vs permanent errors, checks tool-function payloads, and exercises `ensure_alternating_roles` padding so chats recover from provider failures without malformed history.

entries.name: Voice tests guard device selection and VU-meter prompts
entries.description: `tests/basic/test_voice.py` mocks `sounddevice`/`soundfile` to verify device discovery, audio format validation, callback volume percentages, and graceful handling of keyboard interrupts or hardware errors.

entries.name: WholeFileCoder tests protect file fencing and apply_updates
entries.description: `tests/basic/test_wholefile.py` drives `WholeFileCoder` to confirm it prompts before creating files when `yes=False`, re-fences code blocks when backticks exist, and updates in-chat files even when names include prefixes.

entries.name: Scraper tests verify SSL toggles and Playwright fallback
entries.description: `tests/scrape/test_scrape.py` and `tests/scrape/test_playwright_disable.py` assert self-signed failures respect `verify_ssl`, confirm Playwright installs via `/web`, and ensure disabling Playwright falls back to httpx without spurious warnings.

entries.name: Reasoning tag tests guard streamed formatting and cleanup
entries.description: `tests/basic/test_reasoning.py` feeds mocked completions and streaming deltas to confirm reasoning content is wrapped between `REASONING_START/END`, the displayed order precedes the answer, and `remove_reasoning_content` leaves pure assistant output.

entries.name: SSL verification tests propagate --no-verify through clients
entries.description: `tests/basic/test_ssl_verification.py` mocks `httpx` and `ModelInfoManager` to ensure `--no-verify-ssl` flips both sync/async clients, sets `SSL_VERIFY`, and leaves defaults untouched when the flag is absent.

entries.name: Unified diff tests cover /dev/null and spaced paths
entries.description: `tests/basic/test_udiff.py` feeds `find_diffs` with single hunks, `/dev/null` additions, spaced directories, and multi-file patches to ensure unified diff parsing extracts filenames and edit lines consistently.

entries.name: Help tests exercise cmd_help switch and doc URL mapping
entries.description: `tests/help/test_help.py` retries `/help` until `SwitchCoder` fires, validates `Help.ask` returns multi-doc answers, and checks `fname_to_url` normalises Unix/Windows website docs into public URLs.

entries.name: Voice.raw_record_and_transcribe streams audio frames with RMS feedback
entries.description: `Voice.raw_record_and_transcribe` opens a `sounddevice.InputStream`, tracks RMS levels to update the textual progress bar, writes frames to a temporary WAV via `soundfile`, and surfaces friendly errors when devices are missing.

entries.name: Voice converts large WAV recordings before Whisper transcription
entries.description: After recording, `Voice` checks for >24.9â€¯MB WAV files, uses `pydub.AudioSegment` to convert to MP3/WebM when needed, and submits the result to `litellm.transcription(model="whisper-1")`, cleaning up temporary artifacts.

entries.name: Voice initialises sounddevice and validates custom input devices
entries.description: `voice.Voice.__init__` imports `sounddevice`, enumerates devices, matches the configured name to an index, and raises a helpful error listing available inputs when the requested device is absent.

entries.name: Voice constructor raises SoundDeviceError on missing deps
entries.description: `Voice.__init__` fails fast if `soundfile` throws during import or `sounddevice` cannot be loaded, raising `SoundDeviceError` so callers can warn users instead of crashing.

entries.name: Voice enforces supported audio formats at setup
entries.description: `Voice.__init__` checks the requested `audio_format` against `['wav', 'mp3', 'webm']` and raises `ValueError` immediately so unsupported encodings never reach the recording pipeline.

entries.name: Voice renders a dynamic RMS bar in the recording prompt
entries.description: `Voice.callback` tracks running min/max RMS and sets `self.pct`, while `get_prompt` builds a 10-character bar using light and full block characters with elapsed seconds so users know when speech crosses the capture threshold.

entries.name: Voice falls back to 16 kHz when devices lack metadata
entries.description: `Voice.raw_record_and_transcribe` queries the input device's samplerate and, on `TypeError`/`ValueError`, defaults to 16000 Hz before opening the `InputStream`, keeping recording stable on quirky drivers.

entries.name: /voice command lazily initialises recording and sets placeholders
entries.description: `Commands.cmd_voice` verifies `OPENAI_API_KEY`, builds a `voice.Voice` with CLI flags, handles `SoundDeviceError`/`litellm.OpenAIError`, and stores the transcription in `io.placeholder` so the next prompt auto-fills with spoken text.

entries.name: record_and_transcribe wraps recording with friendly error handling
entries.description: `Voice.record_and_transcribe` catches `KeyboardInterrupt` to silently abort and surfaces `SoundDeviceError` messages to users instead of stack traces, matching the CLI behaviour exercised in `tests/basic/test_voice.py`.

entries.name: Voice queues audio blocks before flushing to soundfile
entries.description: `Voice.raw_record_and_transcribe` pushes each callback chunk onto `self.q` and later drains the queue into a temporary WAV, decoupling the PortAudio callback thread from disk IO and ensuring ordered writes.

entries.name: Temporary recordings use soundfile mode='x' to avoid overwrites
entries.description: `Voice.raw_record_and_transcribe` opens the destination with `sf.SoundFile(temp_wav, mode='x')`, raising if the randomly generated name already exists so concurrent sessions never stomp on each other's audio.

entries.name: Voice removes temporary files after transcription completes
entries.description: After sending audio to Whisper, `Voice.raw_record_and_transcribe` deletes converted MP3/WebM files as well as the original WAV, keeping the cache directory tidy even when format conversion was needed.

entries.name: PortAudio errors become actionable SoundDeviceError messages
entries.description: `Voice.raw_record_and_transcribe` wraps `sd.InputStream` in a try/except and raises `SoundDeviceError` with the original `PortAudioError` text when devices are missing, letting the CLI print a human-friendly hint.

entries.name: Voice module suppresses noisy ffmpeg and Syntax warnings
entries.description: On import, `voice.py` filters the common ffmpeg availability warning from pydub and ignores SyntaxWarnings so CLI startup stays quiet unless real audio issues occur.

entries.name: Streamlit CaptureIO mirrors CLI output inside the browser
entries.description: `gui.CaptureIO` subclasses `InputOutput`, collecting `tool_output`, `tool_error`, and `tool_warning` lines for later retrieval so the Streamlit UI can render the CLI transcript inline.

entries.name: GUI multi-select mirrors /add with guardrails and helper text
entries.description: `GUI.do_add_files` renders a `st.multiselect` over `coder.get_all_relative_files()`, seeding selections from `state.initial_inchat_files`, disabling input while prompts are pending, and echoing CLI guidance about adding only files that need edits.

entries.name: Streamlit state resource initializes keys once
entries.description: `gui.State.init` tracks keys in a set so the singleton returned by `@st.cache_resource get_state()` only sets each attribute the first time, letting browser reloads reuse previously computed state.

entries.name: GUI caches the CLI coder and rebinds CaptureIO
entries.description: `gui.get_coder` wraps `main.cli_main(return_coder=True)` in `@st.cache_resource`, raises when no git repo exists, swaps the coder's `commands.io` for `CaptureIO`, and replays announcements so the Streamlit session mirrors the CLI run.

entries.name: GUI surfaces one-click undo for the last aider commit
entries.description: `GUI.show_edit_info` renders commit metadata in an expander and, when the hash matches `coder.last_aider_commit_hash`, `add_undo` uses `st.empty()` to insert a single-use button that calls `do_undo` to execute `/undo` via `coder.commands`.

entries.name: Recent message picker replays prompts through a cached selectbox
entries.description: `GUI.do_recent_msgs` keeps a `st.empty()` placeholder, bumps a counter whenever a prompt is pending, and renders a select box of `state.input_history` that writes the chosen entry back to `self.prompt` for resend.

entries.name: Clear chat history wipes coder message buffers
entries.description: `GUI.do_clear_chat_history` attaches a sidebar button that resets `coder.done_messages` and `coder.cur_messages`, then logs an info message so the next exchange starts from a token-clean slate.

entries.name: GUI.process_chat streams replies and replays reflections
entries.description: `GUI.process_chat` feeds the pending prompt to `coder.run_stream` via `st.write_stream`, appends assistant responses to state, and requeues up to three `coder.reflected_message` iterations so architectural prompts mirror the CLI reflection loop.

entries.name: do_add_web_page wraps Scraper access behind a popover
entries.description: `GUI.do_add_web_page` opens a Streamlit popover, memoises a `Scraper` that respects `has_playwright()`, and injects fetched markdown into the chat as a read-only `text` prompt when content is found.

entries.name: initialize_state deduplicates CLI input history for resend
entries.description: `GUI.initialize_state` pulls entries from `coder.io.get_input_history()`, removes duplicates while preserving order, and stores them under `state.input_history` so the recent message selector never repeats commands.

entries.name: GUI.button disables interactions while a prompt is pending
entries.description: `GUI.button` centralises Streamlit button creation and forces `disabled=True` whenever `prompt_pending()` is true, preventing duplicate actions while the LLM response is streaming.

entries.name: gui_main sets Streamlit page metadata for branded experience
entries.description: `gui_main` configures Streamlit with the favicon, a wide layout, and menu entries pointing to aider docs and bug tracker before instantiating the `GUI` controller, giving the browser shell consistent branding.

entries.name: Browser flag smoke test ensures Streamlit dependency is present
entries.description: `tests/browser/test_browser.py` patches `launch_gui`, launches `main(["--browser", "--yes"])` and makes sure that Streamlit is imported without `ImportError`. This ensures that the CLI option `--browser` continues to pull up GUI dependencies before opening the web client.

entries.name: LazyLiteLLM defers litellm import and silences debug logs
entries.description: `llm.LazyLiteLLM` sets site metadata, defers the `litellm` import until an attribute is accessed, then disables verbose logging (`suppress_debug_info`, `_logging._disable_debugging`) so startup latency and console noise stay low.

entries.name: Main rewires litellm sessions when --no-verify-ssl is used
entries.description: When `--no-verify-ssl` is passed, `main` clears `SSL_VERIFY`, forces `litellm._load_litellm()` so `client_session`/`aclient_session` use `httpx.Client(verify=False)`, and tells `model_info_manager` to skip certificate verification, aligning LLM calls with user intent.

entries.name: model-metadata.json augments LiteLLM with cost and capability flags
entries.description: Entries capture `max_tokens`, cache hit pricing, `supports_prompt_caching`, and provider identifiers for OpenRouter, Gemini, DeepSeek, etc., powering offline model registration.

entries.name: model-settings.yml ties models to edit formats, weak fallbacks, and reminders
entries.description: YAML entries specify `edit_format`, `weak_model_name`, repo map usage, and flags like `examples_as_sys_msg` or `accepts_settings` so aider tunes prompts per provider.

entries.name: llm module suppresses pydantic user warnings
entries.description: `llm.py` sets a warnings filter for `pydantic` UserWarning before importing litellm, preventing noisy startup messages in interactive sessions.

entries.name: sanity_check_messages enforces alternating user and assistant turns
entries.description: The helper validates that non-system messages alternate roles and raises a descriptive error with formatted turns whenever a chat transcript is malformed.

entries.name: ensure_alternating_roles inserts empty turns to fix chat history
entries.description: `ensure_alternating_roles` walks the message list and injects empty opposite-role messages whenever two of the same role appear in a row, keeping deepseek and similar models satisfied.

entries.name: Model.send_completion builds provider-aware litellm kwargs
entries.description: `Model.send_completion` collects model name, streaming, functions and `extra_params`, adds `num_ctx` for Ollama, substitutes `timeout` and transmits to `litellm.completion`. Tests `tests/basic/test_models.py` check the addition `num_ctx`, reusing an existing value and reading `timeout` from `extra_params`, so the wrapper doesn't lose any parameters.

entries.name: Model setters manage thinking token budgets and reasoning effort
entries.description: `set_thinking_tokens` translates numbers and strings with postfix `k/M`, turns off the temperature and writes the settings to `extra_params` or `extra_body.reasoning` for OpenRouter. `tests/basic/test_models.py::test_set_thinking_tokens` confirms both formats and zeroing, so support for reasoning budget remains correct.

entries.name: Ollama completions auto-compute num_ctx from token counts
entries.description: IN `Model.send_completion` for models `ollama/` in the absence `num_ctx` budget is calculated `int(token_count * 1.25) + 8192`, which is transmitted to `litellm.completion`. Test `tests/basic/test_models.py::test_ollama_num_ctx_set_when_missing` checks the calculation and addition of the parameter, and `test_ollama_uses_existing_num_ctx` ensures that the user value is not overwritten.

entries.name: send_completion respects timeout overrides
entries.description: `Model.send_completion` substitutes `timeout=600` by default, but if `extra_params` contains `timeout`, passes this value to `litellm.completion`. IN `tests/basic/test_models.py` two tests (`test_request_timeout_default` And `test_request_timeout_from_extra_params`) check both paths, protecting against regressions.

entries.name: use_temperature flag controls temperature injection in completions
entries.description: `Model.send_completion` writes `temperature=0`, If `use_temperature` true, and omits the parameter completely when the flag is set to `False` (for example, for `github/o1-mini`). `tests/basic/test_models.py::test_use_temperature_settings` checks combinations of values, including a custom number, to protect the channel contract.

entries.name: run_cmd picks interactive pexpect or streaming subprocess as needed
entries.description: `run_cmd` prefers an interactive `pexpect.spawn` on TTY Unix shells and otherwise streams output character-by-character via `subprocess.Popen`, printing chunks while collecting them for downstream use.

entries.name: Temporary directory helpers ignore cleanup failures and seed git repos
entries.description: `utils.IgnorantTemporaryDirectory` suppresses cleanup errors (notably on Windows), `ChdirTemporaryDirectory` restores the previous cwd, and `GitTemporaryDirectory` seeds a repo with default user config for tests.

entries.name: WaitingSpinner drives a unicode-safe progress indicator in a background thread
entries.description: `waiting.WaitingSpinner` launches a daemon thread over the `Spinner` class, hides the cursor while animating, and guarantees cleanup by stopping the thread and clearing the line when the spinner ends.

entries.name: format_messages prints structured chat transcripts for debugging
entries.description: `utils.format_messages` iterates role/content pairs, handles image URL payloads, and produces a human-readable log with separators so developers can inspect raw message sequences.

entries.name: split_chat_history_markdown reconstructs role turns from exported history
entries.description: `utils.split_chat_history_markdown` parses the markdown chat log, distinguishes assistant/tool/user sections, and returns a list of messages ready to replay into the coder.

entries.name: get_pip_install constructs cross-platform pip install commands
entries.description: `utils.get_pip_install` returns `[sys.executable, '-m', 'pip', 'install', ...]` so helper routines can spawn package installs without assuming `pip` is on PATH.

entries.name: run_install streams pip output with a spinner fallback
entries.description: `utils.run_install` prints the shell command, calls `ensurepip` defensively, streams stdout character-by-character while ticking `Spinner("Installing...")`, and returns both success flag and captured output.

entries.name: find_common_root tolerates missing cwd when repos move
entries.description: `utils.find_common_root` tries `os.path.commonpath` across tracked files, falls back to `os.getcwd()` wrapped in `safe_abs_path`, and even tolerates deleted working directories by returning '.'

entries.name: format_tokens abbreviates counts into human-friendly k values
entries.description: `utils.format_tokens` keeps numbers under 1â€¯000 literal, shows one decimal for thousands under 10â€¯000, and rounds above that, ensuring token counters read cleanly in the CLI.

entries.name: touch_file creates parent directories before touching files
entries.description: `utils.touch_file` resolves the `Path`, creates parent folders with `parents=True`, touches the file, and returns a boolean so callers can detect failures (e.g., permission errors).

entries.name: safe_abs_path avoids Windows 8.3 truncation issues
entries.description: `utils.safe_abs_path` resolves the path via `Path(res).resolve()` and returns the string, ensuring Windows callers always get canonical long paths when interacting with git or diff tools.

entries.name: printable_shell_command uses oslex to quote shell strings
entries.description: `utils.printable_shell_command` delegates to `oslex.join(cmd_list)` so prompts and status messages show properly escaped shell commands across POSIX platforms.

entries.name: Analytics only prompts telemetry opt-in for 10% of users
entries.description: `Analytics.need_to_ask` stores the hashed UUID from `analytics.json`, compares its first six hex digits against the `compute_hex_threshold(PERCENT)` (=10â€¯%), and skips prompting whenever the user already opted out or forced telemetry from the CLI.

entries.name: Analytics.enable wires PostHog with system-level super properties
